_meta.name: explanation-concepts
_meta.description: Core concepts and mental models explained
_meta.use_case: You want to understand how doc-evergreen works

sections.heading: # Core Concepts
sections.prompt: Introduction to key concepts (3-4 paragraphs): (1) What makes doc-evergreen different, (2) Core philosophy, (3) Key concepts overview, (4) How to use this guide. Set the stage for understanding.

sections.heading: ## The Template Model
sections.prompt: Explain template concept (5-6 paragraphs): (1) Why templates, (2) Template vs generator, (3) Anatomy of template, (4) How templates work with LLMs, (5) Trade-offs. Build mental model.

sections.heading: ## Chunked Generation
sections.prompt: Explain chunking strategy (5-6 paragraphs): (1) Why chunked vs single-shot, (2) How chunking works, (3) Benefits (quality, flexibility), (4) Trade-offs (time, consistency), (5) When it matters. Focus on understanding 'why'.

sections.heading: ## Source Selection and Context
sections.prompt: Explain context building (4-5 paragraphs): (1) How sources are selected, (2) Context window management, (3) Why specific sources matter, (4) Balancing breadth vs depth. Help readers understand the strategy.

sections.heading: ## Prompt Engineering Principles
sections.prompt: Core prompt engineering ideas (5-7 paragraphs): (1) Why prompts need engineering, (2) Length control philosophy, (3) Specificity vs flexibility, (4) Iteration mindset, (5) Examples of principle in action. Be philosophical but grounded.

sections.heading: ## Living Documentation
sections.prompt: Explain the living docs concept (4-5 paragraphs): (1) What makes docs 'living', (2) Update workflow, (3) Version control integration, (4) Trade-offs vs manual docs. Discuss philosophy and practice.

sections.heading: ## Design Philosophy
sections.prompt: Articulate design values (4-5 paragraphs): (1) Simplicity over features, (2) Templates over configuration, (3) Trust in LLMs, (4) User control. Explain 'why' behind decisions.
